1.title: Lemur Frog
1.plot: The moth-eating lemur frog is one of the Smithsonian's National Zoo's many unique animals. Join the Zoo's experts for an inside look at some of its 2,000 rare and extraordinary creatures.

2.title: Brazilian Rainbow Boa
2.plot: The iridescent Brazilian rainbow boa is one of the Smithsonian's National Zoo's many unique animals. Join the Zoo's experts for an inside look at some of its 2,000 rare and extraordinary creatures.

3.title: Red-Footed Tortoise
3.plot: The resilient red-footed tortoise is one of the Smithsonian's National Zoo's many unique animals. Join the Zoo's experts for an inside look at some of its 2,000 rare and extraordinary creatures.

4.title: Dyeing Poison Dart Frogs
4.plot: With a number of unique color morphs, the dazzling dyeing poison dart frog is is one of the Smithsonian's National Zoo's many unique animals. Join the Zoo's experts for an inside look at some of its 2,000 rare and extraordinary creatures.

5.title: Mata Mata Turtle
5.plot: A mata mata turtle can go 15 minutes between breaths--it's another one of the Smithsonian's National Zoo's many unique animals. Join the Zoo's experts for an inside look at some of its 2,000 rare and extraordinary creatures.

6.title: Chilean Rose Hair Tarantula
6.plot: The bristly Chilean rose hair tarantula is one of the Smithsonian's National Zoo's many unique animals. Join the Zoo's experts for an inside look at some of its 2,000 rare and extraordinary creatures.

7.title: Burrowing Owls
7.plot: The diminutive but versatile burrowing owl, with its distinctively long legs ideal for terrestrial hunting, is one of the Smithsonian's National Zoo's many unique animals. Join the Zoo's experts for an inside look at some of its 2,000 rare and extraordinary creatures.

8.title: Micronesian Kingfisher
8.plot: Extinct in the wild, the brilliantly colored Micronesian kingfisher thrives in captivity at the Smithsonian's National Zoo. Join the Zoo's experts for an inside look at some of its 2,000 rare and extraordinary creatures.

9.title: Brown Kiwi
9.plot: The tiny and flightless North Island brown kiwi is one of the most distinctive birds at the Smithsonian's National Zoo. Join the Zoo's experts for an inside look at some of its 2,000 rare and extraordinary creatures.

10.title: Pileated Woodpecker
10.plot: The pileated woodpecker uses its beak to carve out a nest inside a tree, an uncommon skill among the birds of the Smithsonian's National Zoo. Join the Zoo's experts for an inside look at some of its 2,000 rare and extraordinary creatures.

11.title: Baltimore Orioles
11.plot: The Baltimore oriole's high-contrast plumage makes it a dazzling standout at the Smithsonian's National Zoo. Join the Zoo's experts for an inside look at some of its 2,000 rare and extraordinary creatures.

12.title: Scarlet Ibis
12.plot: The rosy sheen of the scarlet ibis stands out among the many birds of the Smithsonian's National Zoo. Join the Zoo's experts for an inside look at some of its 2,000 rare and extraordinary creatures.

1.title: Panamanian Golden Frog
1.plot: The minuscule and nearly extinct Panamanian golden frog is in fact a toad--and yet another one of the Smithsonian's National Zoo's many unique animals. Join the Zoo's experts for an inside look at some of its 2,000 rare and extraordinary creatures.

2.title: European Glass Lizard
2.plot: It looks like a snake, but it's not. The illusive European glass lizard is one of the Smithsonian's National Zoo's many unique animals. Join the Zoo's experts for an inside look at some of its 2,000 rare and extraordinary creatures.

3.title: Cuban Crocodile
3.plot: The remarkably terrestrial Cuban crocodile is one of the Smithsonian's National Zoo's many unique animals. Join the Zoo's experts for an inside look at some of its 2,000 rare and extraordinary creatures.

4.title: Giant Leaf-Tailed Gecko
4.plot: The often-camouflaged and nocturnal giant leaf-tailed gecko is one of the Smithsonian's National Zoo's many unique animals. Join the Zoo's experts for an inside look at some of its 2,000 rare and extraordinary creatures.

5.title: Spider Tortoises
5.plot: One of the smallest tortoises in the world, the critically endangered spider tortoise is one of the Smithsonian's National Zoo's many unique animals. Join the Zoo's experts for an inside look at some of its 2,000 rare and extraordinary creatures.

6.title: Veiled Chameleon
6.plot: The color-changing veiled chameleon is one of the Smithsonian's National Zoo's many unique animals. Join the Zoo's experts for an inside look at some of its 2,000 rare and extraordinary creatures.

imdb.title: Light Talks
plot: Among the Smithsonian National Zoo's 2,000 animals are nearly 400 different species, many of which are critically endangered. Join the Zoo's experts for an inside look at some of its most rare and extraordinary creatures.
